newsitem.title: USA: AT&T names new AT&T Wireless president/CEO.
newsitem.headline: AT&T names new AT&T Wireless president/CEO.

text.p: AT&T Corp said Thursday that it has named Dan Hesse president and chief executive of AT&T Wireless Services and executive vice president of AT&T.
Hesse succeeds Steve Hooper, who is leaving the company, AT&T said. The appointment is effective May 12.
Previously, Hesse was vice president and general manager of business development. Prior to that, he was vice president and general manager of AT&T's Internet businesses.

Hooper, along with AT&T Wireless Vice Chairman Wayne Perry and Gerald Salemme, who helped AT&T's lobbying efforts on new telecommunications legislation, have all resigned to form a joint venture with their former boss, Craig McCaw.
The venture, OneComm LLC, would be involved in competitve local telephone services.
AT&T and OneComm also announced Thursday that they plan to work together to bring competition to selected local communications markets.
